title: Unable to View Email Contents
content:
Hi,

I use Thunderbird as my e-mail client and have been saving e-mails from the inbox into a shared folder on my internal server for many years now. Normally, when I double click to open an e-mail saved into the shared folder, the e-mail will open in Thunderbird and I can click reply, forward, etc. However, since June 17, 2025, whenever I open these e-mails saved in the shared folder, only the subject of the email and two rows of menu bars (i.e., File, Edit, View, Get Messages, Write, Tag, etc.) appear, but the contents of the e-mail do not, including sender information. I've attached a screenshot so you can see what I mean (ignore the black background which I have set). Even though I can click "Messages" --> "Reply" in the menu bar, the composition window that pops up does not show any details of the e-mail I am responding to. However, if I transfer the e-mail file from the shared folder on the internal server to anywhere in my computer, say, the Desktop, the file will open normally in Thunderbird and display all contents normally. Would appreciate it if anyone could help me figure out how to solve this problem. My colleagues and I all need access to these e-mails saved in the shared folder so we can't keep saving them on to our computers. Thanks so much!
creator: inmeng.c.wong

title: RICHIESTA ASSISTENZA.
content: Gentili signore/i, buongiorno. Ho creato un accaunt Thunderbird, lasciando le impostazioni di default. Ho esportato dalla mia casella PEC di Altapec, che dovevo svuotare, il contenuto delle cartelle PEC IN ARRIVO, INVIATE e delle BOZZE. Ho scaricato il contenuto delle tre cartelle PEC sul mio pc. In Thunderbird, sotto la voce Cartelle locali, apparivano gli Inboxes delle tre cartelle sopracitate con il contenuto scaricato. Ho provato ad aprire, sul mio pc, con Thunderbird gli Inboxes ed ho potuto leggere le PEC. Poi ho eliminato definitivamente dalla casella queste tre cartelle. Fatto questo, ho provato a leggere nuovamente il contenuto degli Imboxes scaricati sul mio pc: purtoppo, sotto la voce Cartelle Locali in Thunderbird gli Inboxes scaricati sono spariti. Chiedo cortesemente: 1) le PEC scaricate esistono ancora sul mio pc, oppure, avendo svuotato la casella PEC, detto contenuto è andato perduto? 2) ho commesso qualche errore e, se sì, come rimediare? Attendo una vostra risposta, se potete. Grazie e cordiali saluti. 10/07/2025 Renato Pascariello

title: New issue - extra spaces inserted when deleting characters using backspace key
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for a long time but this is something I've not seen before today.

I was editing an old message (via 'Forward') to produce a new message - an agenda for a regular meeting. I started to delete words from a line of text, going from the right-hand side using the backspace key. When I reached the beginning of the first deleted word (i.e. after deleting the first character in the word, before I could delete the preceding space) the cursor jumped about 20 characters to the right, as if a big tab had been inserted.

The line now had extra space characters on the end of it. I could delete those with Backspace one at a time and then move on to the next word now at the end of the line. When I reached the beginning of that word the cursor jumped to the right again - though not necessarily by the same number of characters.

Weirdly, this didn't happen with every word. Sometimes I could get to the beginning of a word and could go straight on to delete the space in front of it.

Deleting text by other methods (e.g. using the Delete key to go from left to right, or highlighting text and using Ctrl/X) work as normal.

This is not a phenomenon limited to a specific message. I've tried editing other messages and the same thing happens, but with different numbers of spaces inserted. I'm really not sure what's going on or why it has suddenly started to happen.

Can this issue be replicated by others? I'm currently using Thunderbird 140.0.1 on up-to-date Windows 11 (though I was using 139.xx earlier today when I first noticed this).
creator: graham.s.thomas

content:
Diversas vezes ao tentar enviar um email pelo thunderbird aparecem tais mensagens: "Expirou o tempo de conexão ao servidor" e "Sua mensagem foi enviada mas uma cópia não foi adicionada a sua pasta de Enviados (Enviadas) devido a problema na rede ou no acesso à arquivos. Você pode tentar novamente ou salvas a mensagem localmente em Pastas Locais" Porém isso é instável, algumas vezes o email é enviado normalmente e outras não. Acredito que não seja problema em minha rede pois antigamente esses problemas não aconteciam, e eu nunca fiz nenhuma alteração na internet, rede ou no computador. title: RICHIESTA SUPPORTO
content: Buon pomeriggio e grazie per la cortese risposta. Ho solo creato l'account Thunderbird; ho lasciato per i protocolli e le altre impostazioni, tutto come predefinito. I file sono del tipo INBOX.mbox. La cartella che li contiene sul mio pc riporta il peso di ogni file, che non è affatto zero. Ora mi chiedo: 1) perché il gestore Altapec mi dice che i files non sono stati eliminati dalla mia casella, mentre io ho verificato in tutte le cartelle di detta casella che non c'è nulla, eccetto una PEC? 1) se i files non sono stati definitivamente eliminati, allora il gestore della mia casella PEC non può recuperare dal proprio server questi files con un programma recupero dati e inviarmeli? Attendo, se possibile, una cortese risposta. Cordialmente, Renato Pascariello

title: Help please - Thunderbird not fetching POP messages
content:
I'm having an e-mail emergency, and will be very grateful for any assistance. Running TB 128.12.0esr (32-bit) on a 64-bit Win10 PC.

Earlier today, Thunderbird stopped sending or receiving via my main account, on an Earthlink-hosted domain that I own. Turned out that I can still send from accounts on two other domains, one a shared-hosting domain that I own; the other is Verizon/AOL. But I cannot seem to download from any of the three domains.

I checked all the SMTP and POP settings, which worked a few hours ago and have not changed. Restarted Thunderbird several times, inlcusing in safe mode, and rebooted the PC twice. Clicking "Get Messages" - globally or by account - does nothing. The thin blue "working" bar at lower right keeps scrolling, even if I press the Stop button.

I would prefer not to mess around with setting up new profiles and all. Can anyone here please suggest anything less complicated and risky that might get mail working again?

THANKS in advance!
